What are the seven matters of water?
If a person is drowning in the water;
after emerging from the water, they sink back into the water;
or they emerge from the water and look around in all directions;
or they emerge from the water and do not sink back in;
or there is a person who wants to leave the water;
or there is a person who wants to reach the other shore;
or there is a person who has already reached the other shore, with a pure mind standing on the other shore.
What kind of person is drowning in the water?

There may be a person who is completely wrapped in unwholesome states, with only sinful actions, who will go to hell for an eon and suffer unbearably. This is called a person who is always submerged in the water. This is called the first person who enters the water and is submerged.
What kind of person is the one who emerges from the water but sinks back in?

There may be a person who is like this, submerged, but has faith in wholesome states, has a sense of shame, and seeks the means to be ashamed of all unwholesome states. They emerge from the water but sink back into the water. This is called the second person who is submerged in the water.
What kind of person is the one who emerges from the water and looks around in all directions?
There may be a person who emerges from the water, who has faith in wholesome states, has a sense of shame, and has a courageous mind, ashamed of all unwholesome states.
They emerge from the water and do not sink back in.
Virtuous ones, this is called the third person who emerges from the water.
What kind of person is the one who emerges from the water and stays there?

There is one person who emerges from the water like this, who has faith in the good Dharma, has a sense of shame, and has diligence in the good dharmas, and has a sense of shame towards all of them. He exhausts the three fetters and becomes a stream-enterer who does not regress, and will definitely return to where he belongs. This is called the person who emerges from the water and stays there, like the fourth person.
What kind of person is the one who emerges from the water and wants to reach the other shore?

There is one person who emerges from the water like this. He has faith in the good Dharma, has a sense of shame, and has a courageous mind, and has a sense of shame towards all of the good dharmas. He exhausts the three fetters, and his greed, hatred, and delusion are weakened. He becomes a once-returner and comes to this world to end suffering. This is called the person who is like the one in the water who wants to reach the other shore.
What kind of person is the one who has already reached the other shore?

Some people emerge from the water, have faith in the good Dharma, have a sense of shame, and have a courageous mind. They are ashamed of all good dharmas, and they completely sever the five lower bonds, become non-returners, and attain nirvana in that very life, not returning to this world. These are called the six people who emerge from the water and reach the other shore.
What kind of person is said to have reached the other shore, to have attained the pure mind and stood on the other shore?
Some people emerge from the water, have faith in the good Dharma, have a sense of shame, and have a courageous mind. They are ashamed of all good dharmas;

Some people completely sever the defilements and attain the undefiled state, attain liberation through mindfulness and wisdom, and quickly attain realization in this very life, delighting in ending the source of birth and death.
The practice of austerity has been established, what was to be done has been done, and they will not again experience birth in a womb.
These are called the people who are like those who emerge from the water and stand on the other shore.
